title: ggcalheat: calendar heatmaps with ggplot2
text: vignette uses multi-year daily series (2022 2025) show calendar heatmaps larger data.
code: all_dates <- seq.Date(as.Date("2022-01-01"), as.Date("2025-12-31"), by = "day") n <- length(all_dates)  doy <- as.integer(format(all_dates, "%j")) dow <- as.POSIXlt(all_dates)$wday is_weekend <- dow %in% c(0, 6)  traffic <- data.frame(   date = all_dates,   value = pmax(     0,     round(       24 +         9 * sin(2 * pi * doy / 365.25) +         ifelse(is_weekend, -8, 2) +         rnorm(n, sd = 4)     )   ) ) traffic$year <- format(traffic$date, "%Y")

what: Basic usage on large daily series
title: ggcalheat: calendar heatmaps with ggplot2
code: ggplot(traffic, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar() +   facet_wrap(~year, ncol = 1) +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "grey95", high = "#2C7FB8", name = "Traffic") +   labs(title = "Daily traffic (2022-2025)") +   theme_minimal()

what: Signed data with a diverging scale
title: ggcalheat: calendar heatmaps with ggplot2
text: values include negative positive values, use diverging fill scale midpoint = 0.
code: anomaly <- data.frame(   date = seq.Date(as.Date("2025-01-01"), as.Date("2025-12-31"), by = "day") )  anomaly_doy <- as.integer(format(anomaly$date, "%j")) anomaly$value <- round(   2.5 * sin(2 * pi * anomaly_doy / 365.25) + rnorm(nrow(anomaly), sd = 1.8),   2 )  ggplot(anomaly, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar() +   scale_fill_gradient2(     low = "#B2182B",     mid = "white",     high = "#2166AC",     midpoint = 0,     name = "Anomaly"   ) +   labs(title = "Signed daily anomalies") +   theme_minimal()

title: ggcalheat: calendar heatmaps with ggplot2
text: default, geom_calendar() uses Sunday first day week. can switch Monday.
code: q1_2025 <- traffic[   traffic$date >= as.Date("2025-01-01") &     traffic$date <= as.Date("2025-03-31"), ]  ggplot(q1_2025, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar(week_start = "monday") +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "grey95", high = "#1B9E77", name = "Traffic") +   labs(title = "Q1 2025, Monday-first calendar") +   theme_minimal()

title: ggcalheat: calendar heatmaps with ggplot2
text: geom_calendar() can fill missing dates larger display range using na_value.
code: sparse <- data.frame(   date = sort(sample(     seq.Date(as.Date("2025-01-01"), as.Date("2025-12-31"), by = "day"),     120   )),   value = rpois(120, lambda = 6) )  ggplot(sparse, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar(     start_date = as.Date("2024-11-01"),     end_date = as.Date("2025-12-31"),     na_value = 0   ) +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "grey95", high = "#D95F02", name = "Events") +   labs(title = "Sparse data completed over an explicit window") +   theme_minimal()

title: ggcalheat: calendar heatmaps with ggplot2
text: source multiple rows per day, geom_calendar() aggregates day sum(value).
code: events <- data.frame(   date = sample(     seq.Date(as.Date("2025-01-01"), as.Date("2025-06-30"), by = "day"),     size = 2500,     replace = TRUE   ),   value = rgamma(2500, shape = 2.5, rate = 1 / 1.5) )  ggplot(events, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar() +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "grey95", high = "#7570B3", name = "Sum/day") +   labs(title = "Event-level rows aggregated per day") +   theme_minimal()

title: ggcalheat: calendar heatmaps with ggplot2
text: can control tile geometry borders denser lighter visual style.
code: yr2024 <- traffic[traffic$year == "2024", ]  ggplot(yr2024, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar(     cell_width = 0.85,     cell_height = 0.85,     color = "white",     linewidth = 0.25   ) +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "#F7FCF5", high = "#238B45", name = "Traffic") +   labs(title = "2024 with tighter tiles and white borders") +   theme_minimal()

title: ggcalheat: calendar heatmaps with ggplot2
text: Calendar heatmaps can faceted like regular ggplot2 layers.
code: teams <- c("North", "Central", "South") team_data <- do.call(   rbind,   lapply(seq_along(teams), function(i) {     d <- seq.Date(as.Date("2025-01-01"), as.Date("2025-12-31"), by = "day")     seasonal <- 20 + 7 * sin(2 * pi * as.integer(format(d, "%j")) / 365.25)     data.frame(       team = teams[i],       date = d,       value = pmax(0, round(seasonal + i * 3 + rnorm(length(d), sd = 3)))     )   }) )  ggplot(team_data, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar() +   facet_wrap(~team, ncol = 1) +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "grey95", high = "#66A61E", name = "Value") +   labs(title = "Team calendars") +   theme_minimal()

title: ggcalheat: calendar heatmaps with ggplot2
text: geom_calendar_interactive() uses ggiraph tiles can expose tooltips IDs.
code: library(ggiraph)  interactive_df <- traffic[traffic$year == "2025", ]  p_interactive <- ggplot(interactive_df, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar_interactive(     aes(       tooltip = paste0("Date: ", date, "\nValue: ", value),       data_id = as.character(date)     ),     color = "white",     linewidth = 0.2   ) +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "grey95", high = "#2C7FB8", name = "Traffic") +   labs(title = "Interactive 2025 calendar") +   theme_minimal()  girafe(ggobj = p_interactive)

title: ggcalheat: calendar heatmaps with ggplot2
text: Required aesthetics date value. Continuous diverging color behavior controlled standard ggplot2 scales. Use geom_calendar_interactive() ggiraph tooltips clickable tiles. production reports, consider fixed date windows (start_date, end_date) plots directly comparable.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Joseph Barbier. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Barbier J (2026). ggcalheat: Calendar Heatmaps R. R package version 0.1.1, https://y-sunflower.github.io/ggcalheat/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggcalheat: Calendar Heatmaps in R},   author = {Joseph Barbier},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {https://y-sunflower.github.io/ggcalheat/}, }

title: Calendar heatmaps in R
text: ggcalheat provides calendar heatmaps ggplot2 simple API: map date value, call geom_calendar().

title: Calendar heatmaps in R
text: Signed values supported directly standard continuous scales:   Interactive ggiraph  See examples
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggcalheat)  df <- data.frame(   date = seq.Date(as.Date("2025-01-01"), as.Date("2025-12-31"), by = "day"),   value = rpois(365, lambda = 3) )  ggplot(df, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar() +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "grey95", high = "#2C7FB8") +   theme_minimal() df <- data.frame(   date = seq.Date(as.Date("2025-01-01"), as.Date("2025-12-31"), by = "day"),   value = rnorm(365, mean = 0, sd = 2) )  ggplot(df, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar() +   scale_fill_gradient2(     low = "#B2182B",     mid = "white",     high = "#2166AC",     midpoint = 0   ) +   theme_minimal() library(ggplot2) library(ggcalheat) library(ggiraph)  gg <- ggplot(df, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar_interactive(aes(     tooltip = paste("Date:", date, "\nValue:", round(value, 1)),     data_id = as.character(date)   )) +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "white", high = "purple") +   theme_minimal()  girafe(ggobj = gg)

title: Calendar heatmap geometry — geom_calendar
text: geom_calendar() draws one tile per day computes calendar positions input data. Users need map date value; week/day placement handled internally.

title: Calendar heatmap geometry — geom_calendar
code: geom_calendar(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   ...,   week_start = "sunday",   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   na_value = 0,   cell_width = 0.95,   cell_height = 0.95,   square = TRUE,   color = NA,   linewidth = 0,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Calendar heatmap geometry — geom_calendar
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created ggplot2::aes(). Must include date value. data data frame. ... Additional parameters passed ggplot2::layer(). week_start First day week. One "sunday", "monday", 0, 1. start_date Optional lower date bound displayed range. end_date Optional upper date bound displayed range. na_value Value assigned dates missing input data. cell_width Width day tile. cell_height Height day tile. square TRUE, adds ggplot2::coord_fixed() (ratio = 1) day cells render squares default. color Tile border color. linewidth Tile border line width. na.rm Passed ggplot2::geom_tile() control NA handling. show.legend layer included legends? inherit.aes FALSE, overrides global aesthetics.

title: Calendar heatmap geometry — geom_calendar
text: ggplot2 component. default includes calendar layer plus ggplot2::coord_fixed() day tiles stay square.

title: Calendar heatmap geometry — geom_calendar
text: Duplicate dates aggregated summing values plotting.

title: Calendar heatmap geometry — geom_calendar
code: library(ggplot2)  set.seed(1) daily <- data.frame(   date = seq.Date(as.Date("2025-01-01"), as.Date("2025-03-31"), by = "day"),   value = rpois(90, lambda = 3) )  ggplot(daily, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar() +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "grey95", high = "#2C7FB8")   signed_values <- data.frame(   date = seq.Date(as.Date("2025-01-01"), as.Date("2025-02-28"), by = "day"),   value = rnorm(59, mean = 0, sd = 2) )  ggplot(signed_values, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar() +   scale_fill_gradient2(     low = "#B2182B",     mid = "white",     high = "#2166AC"   )

what: Interactive calendar heatmap geometry for ggiraph — geom_calendar_interactive
title: Interactive calendar heatmap geometry for ggiraph — geom_calendar_interactive
text: geom_calendar_interactive() behaves like geom_calendar() draws tiles ggiraph's interactive geometry.

title: Interactive calendar heatmap geometry for ggiraph — geom_calendar_interactive
code: geom_calendar_interactive(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   ...,   week_start = "sunday",   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   na_value = 0,   cell_width = 0.95,   cell_height = 0.95,   square = TRUE,   color = NA,   linewidth = 0,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Interactive calendar heatmap geometry for ggiraph — geom_calendar_interactive
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created ggplot2::aes(). Must include date value. data data frame. ... Additional parameters passed ggplot2::layer(). week_start First day week. One "sunday", "monday", 0, 1. start_date Optional lower date bound displayed range. end_date Optional upper date bound displayed range. na_value Value assigned dates missing input data. cell_width Width day tile. cell_height Height day tile. square TRUE, adds ggplot2::coord_fixed() (ratio = 1) day cells render squares default. color Tile border color. linewidth Tile border line width. na.rm Passed ggplot2::geom_tile() control NA handling. show.legend layer included legends? inherit.aes FALSE, overrides global aesthetics.

title: Interactive calendar heatmap geometry for ggiraph — geom_calendar_interactive
text: ggplot2 component using ggiraph interactive geometry. default includes ggplot2::coord_fixed() day tiles stay square.

title: Interactive calendar heatmap geometry for ggiraph — geom_calendar_interactive
text: default, day : data_id = .character(date) tooltip = paste0(date, ": ", value) can override mapping interactive aesthetics (tooltip, data_id, onclick, etc.) inside ggplot2::aes().

title: Interactive calendar heatmap geometry for ggiraph — geom_calendar_interactive
code:
library(ggplot2) library(ggiraph)  set.seed(42) daily <- data.frame(   date = seq.Date(as.Date("2025-01-01"), as.Date("2025-01-31"), by = "day"),   value = rpois(31, lambda = 3) )  p <- ggplot(daily, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar_interactive(     aes(       tooltip = paste("Date:", date, "
Value:", value),       data_id = date     )   ) +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "grey95", high = "#2C7FB8")  girafe(ggobj = p)  {"x":{"html":"<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
